Unexpected file downloads or execution a.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 5156, Zeek http.log, Zeek file.log
Unexpected file downloads or execution a.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation events initiated by web browsers or common document viewers. Analyze Zeek http.log and file.log for unexpected file downloads associated with benign-looking HTTP requests. Use correlation analysis to link file downloads to subsequent suspicious process activity. Identify rare file types or download sources using frequency analysis.

Network connections initiated by injecte.Data: Windows Event ID 5156, Zeek conn.log, Zeek dns.log
Network connections initiated by injecte.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and Windows Event ID 5156 for new outbound network connections from processes associated with recently accessed websites or documents. Compare destination IPs/domains against known good lists and threat intelligence feeds. Use descriptive statistics or entropy measures on connection parameters (e.g., destination port distribution) to identify anomalies.

Unusual network traffic patterns or dest.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek dns.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek tls.log
Unusual network traffic patterns or dest.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log, dns.log, http.log, and tls.log for unusual communication patterns that might indicate covert C2. Look for connections to known malicious IPs/domains, unusual domain generation algorithm (DGA) patterns using entropy analysis on domain names, or irregular data sizes/frequencies using time series analysis on connection volumes/durations.

Observation of unexpected data exfiltrat.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek file.log
Observation of unexpected data exfiltrat.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log and http.log for unusual data transfers, particularly outbound traffic that doesn't conform to expected patterns (e.g., large uploads from unexpected sources, data hidden within seemingly normal requests/responses). Use linear regression or correlation analysis to identify deviations from baseline data transfer volumes for specific hosts or services.
